conclusion: To determine the refractive index of the transparent medium, analyze the path of the light beam using Snell's Law and geometry.
Identify the given information: radius of hemisphere is R, distance from D to AC is (sqrt(3)/2)R, distance DE is sqrt(2)R, speed of light in vacuum is c.
Determine the coordinates of point D using the geometry of the circle.
Coordinates of D are (sqrt(3)/2 R, 1/2 R, 0) because distance from D to AC is (sqrt(3)/2)R and radius is R.
Calculate the angle of incidence theta_1 as the angle between the incident ray and the normal at point D.
Theta_1 is tan^(-1)(sqrt(3)/2) because tangent of angle is (sqrt(3)/2)R/R.
Use Snell's Law at point E to find angle of refraction theta_2: n sin(theta_1) = sin(theta_2).
Coordinates of E are (sqrt(6)/2 R, 1/2 R, 0) using distance DE = sqrt(2)R.
Calculate theta_2 as tan^(-1)(1/sqrt(6)) because tangent of theta_2 is (1/2 R)/(sqrt(6)/2 R).
Using Snell's Law and identity sin(tan^(-1)(x)) = x/sqrt(1+x^2), solve for n.
Simplify equation to find n = sqrt(3)/3.
The refractive index of the transparent medium is sqrt(3).
